reviewText: This DVD features an amazing band, set list and venue. Every song is a joy to hear and the chemistry on stage is great. In the beginning of the DVD, they play many hits and many songs you've probably never heard before (but they're still really, really good). And the performance just keeps getting better. Once the rain starts, this 4th of July celebration truly becomes a gem. A must have for any Goo Goo Dolls fan or person who enjoys watching concerts. 5 stars awarded and 6 stars deserved.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Purchased as a gift for a mate. He says its pretty darn good, but I suppose you have to be a GGD fan to like it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Buy it, and see for yourself. Absolutely one of the best live concerts you will ever view, and you get to watch it dry. End of Song #9, is when Johnny Rzeznik hold up the poster given to him by a fan: "Polish Guys Kick Ass!" The Buffalo crowd went wild!Song #18 IRIS is just so great. Iris is worth the price of this DVD alone.Wow!!!Tock Mormor/Thanks Grandma for letting me write this.
summary: "POLISH GUYS DO KICK ASS!" POSTER RZEZNIK HOLDS UP TO FANS AT END OF SONG #9. IRIS... AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This 4th of July concert is very enjoyable and can be listened to again and again. They do all of their greatest hits and some others too. It is an outdoor concert adding to the charm of the event. And just to make things interesting, it starts pouring about half-way through the concert.
summary: Excellent Concert & Excellent Transfer  To DVD

reviewText: yesterday I watched this concert on DVD and I can confirm the aspect ratio is widescreen 1.78 / 16:9 an not fullscreen, audio is presented in dolby 5.1 too, this is a great concert I just wish it had some more songs

reviewText: I love the Goo Goo Dolls but have never seen them in concert. This DVD is great and I highly recommend it to people who are fans of the band

reviewText: Unbelievable spectacle.  I am a huge Goo Goo Dolls fan and had always heard this is a must own for my music collection.  I hate the word "epic" when it's used as a slang term as I feel it detracts from the power of the word.  With that said, this concert is truly EPIC!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great DVD of this ill-fated, stormy concert in Buffalo.Johnny Rezeznik proves that he and his band have the hearts of true rockers by putting on a show in a monsoon!My wife and I are ga-ga for the Goo Goos!
